messages.subject: Re: Duty and teaparties
messages.msgSnippet: ... I love all things Elizabeth Gaskell. Wives and Daughters is my favourite, though, and I love the BCC series. And... I found you your context.
messages.messageBody:
--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Dodd <Sandra@...> wrote:
>
> I watched a BBC miniseries on netflix the other day. "Wives and
> Daughters."

I love all things Elizabeth Gaskell. Wives and Daughters is my favourite, though, and I love the BCC series.

And... I found you your context.

http://books.google.ca/books?id=D93zanaLBD4C&pg=PA452#v=onepage&q&f=false

- Rebecca

messages.subject: Duty and teaparties
messages.msgSnippet: I watched a BBC miniseries on netflix the other day.  Wives and Daughters. I ve had deep feeling about duty, for I think it  should only be spoken about in
messages.messageBody:
I watched a BBC miniseries on netflix the other day. "Wives and
Daughters."


"I've had deep feeling about duty, for I think it should only be
spoken about in church and sacred places like that, not in someone's
sitting room with everyone drinking tea."

I don't know if that line is in the book. If someone knows or has the
book and wants to look (maybe it's online searchable), that might be
fun to know. Maybe the speech was longer in the book, or maybe it was
written for the TV script.

I liked it a lot, though, because it reinforces my funny side-theory
about "tea party behavior."

I would much prefer to discuss duty than to spend a minute in
someone's sitting room with everyone drinking tea.

Sandra
